sections.heading: What is Business Analytics?
sections.content: Business analytics is the process of using data, statistical analysis, and modeling to drive business decision-making. It helps organizations understand trends, predict outcomes, and improve performance.

sections.heading: Use Cases of Analytics in Business
sections.content:
• Identifying customer preferences
  • Optimizing marketing campaigns
  • Forecasting sales
  • Improving operational efficiency
  • Reducing churn
  • Enhancing inventory and supply chain planning
Analytics transforms raw data into strategic insights.

sections.heading: Types of Analytics
sections.content:
• Descriptive: What happened?
  • Diagnostic: Why did it happen?
  • Predictive: What will happen?
  • Prescriptive: What should we do?

sections.heading: Benefits of Analytics Over Experience
sections.content:
• Objectivity: Data is evidence-based
  • Scale: Can analyze massive datasets
  • Precision: Reduces guesswork

sections.heading: Analytics Lifecycle/Process
sections.content:
1. Define the problem (business question & KPI)
  2. Data acquisition (sources, collection methods)
  3. Process & prep data (cleaning, transformation)
  4. Analyze data & interpret results (visualizations, summary stats)
  5. Communicate findings (build an executive summary or slide deck tailored to stakeholders; tell the 'data story')

sections.heading: Key Roles & Skills in Analytics
sections.content:
• Data Analyst: Focuses on interpreting data and providing actionable insights.
  • Data Scientist: Combines programming, statistics, and domain knowledge to extract insights from data.
  • Business Intelligence Analyst: Uses data visualization tools to present data in a way that is easy to understand.

sections.heading: Tools & Technologies
sections.content:
• Excel: Basic data analysis and visualization
  • SQL: Database querying
  • Python/R: Advanced analytics and machine learning
  • Tableau/Power BI: Data visualization

sections.heading: Common Challenges in Analytics
sections.content:
• Data quality issues
  • Integration of data from multiple sources
  • Stakeholder buy-in
  • Resistance to change within the organization
  • Understanding the business context
  • Ethics & privacy

sections.heading: Reflection
sections.content: Think about a business problem you've encountered. How could analytics have changed the outcome? Write down your thoughts.
